item.title: High Stakes for Sudan in the South’s Conflict
item.description: With the flow of oil and border security at risk, longstanding rivals discuss joint patrols of South Sudan’s oil fields, among other measures.
item.category: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
item.dc:creator: By ISMA’IL KUSHKUSH and NICHOLAS KULISH
item.media:description: South Sudanese refugees have fled fighting to Uganda. Regional leaders worry that the crisis in South Sudan will increase the flow of refugees.

item.title: Dubai Journal: After Winning Expo, Emirate Fumes at Allies It Says Didn’t Back It
item.description: After Pakistan and Afghanistan were accused of casting their votes for other cities in the competition for the 2020 World Expo, the score-settling started.
item.dc:creator: By AZAM AHMED
item.media:description: Celebrations of the United Arab Emirates’ National Day last month and Dubai’s selection to host the 2020 World Expo.

item.title: Israeli Official Points to ‘Incitement’ by Palestinians
item.description: Palestinians dismiss the accusation as an effort to distract attention from disagreements over issues like borders.
item.dc:creator: By JODI RUDOREN

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: China Destroys 6 Tons of Ivory
item.description: Chinese authorities on Monday destroyed confiscated ivory ornaments and tusks in Dongguan, a city in the southern province of Guangdong, which is a major hub for the ivory trade.
item.category: Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species
item.dc:creator: By BETTINA WASSENER
item.media:description: Customs officers stood guard in front of illegal ivory as it was destroyed in Dongguan.

item.title: Rebel Infighting Spreads to an Eastern Syrian City
item.description: Some antigovernment activists said the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria, a Qaeda affiliate, had been routed from the eastern city of Raqqa.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
Islamic State of Iraq and Syria
item.dc:creator: By ANNE BARNARD and RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: 10 Years for Plot to Murder Cartoonist
item.description: Colleen R. LaRose, of Pennsylvania, plotted to kill a Swedish cartoonist and told a judge she was once obsessed with jihad.
item.dc:creator: By JON HURDLE

item.title: World Briefing | Europe: Czech Officials Demand Explanation for Weapons at Palestinian Mission
item.description: The authorities in Prague said they found 12 illegal weapons during their investigation into the death of the Palestinian ambassador.
item.dc:creator: By HANA de GOEIJ

item.title: British Economic Debate Opens Ahead of 2015 Vote
item.description: Citing a robust economy, Prime Minister David Cameron’s government promised more austerity, while the opposition Labour Party demanded better protections for low-wage workers.
item.dc:creator: By STEPHEN CASTLE

item.title: Czech Parties Agree to Form Center-Left Coalition
item.description: Bohuslav Sobotka, a former finance minister known for his uncharismatic personal style, was expected to become prime minister.
item.dc:creator: By DAN BILEFSKY

item.title: The Lede: In Video and on Twitter, Glimpses of Rodman’s North Korea Trip
item.description: Dennis Rodman, who has repeatedly called his visits “basketball diplomacy,” brushed aside any suggestion that he will use his influence with the North Korean leader Kim Jong-un for anything other than sports.
item.dc:creator: By CHRISTINE HAUSER

item.title: The Lede: New Rules for Workers From Europe’s East Prompt Xenophobia in the West
item.description: The European Union’s relaxation of work restrictions for Romanians and Bulgarians on New Year’s Day has revived a Europe-wide debate on immigration.
item.dc:creator: By DAN BILEFSKY

item.title: Iran Offers Military Aid, but Not Troops, to Iraq
item.description: Gen. Mohammed Hejazi, deputy commander of Iran’s armed forces, offered equipment and advice but said Iraq had not officially requested such help.
item.category: Islamic State of Iraq and Syria
item.dc:creator: By THOMAS ERDBRINK

item.title: Iran Urged to Use Influence With Syrian Leader
item.description: State Department officials said Iran could improve its chances of joining peace talks if it could get President Bashar al-Assad to stop bombing Aleppo.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL R. GORDON

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: U.S. Ambassador Renews Ties to His Ancestral Village
item.description: In December, Gary Locke, the departing United States ambassador to China, made his fifth visit to his ancestral village, in a region that was once the main point of departure for immigrants to America.
item.dc:creator: By EDWARD WONG

item.title: India Ink: Image of the Day: January 6
item.description: Children on the outskirts of Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, walking on a snow-covered road.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES

item.title: India Ink: Human Rights Chairman Said to Resign Over Harassment Accusation
item.description: A.K. Ganguly had been under pressure to vacate his post since a Supreme Court panel found he had shown “unwelcome behavior” toward a law intern in a hotel room.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By HARI KUMAR

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: The Curious, and Continuing, Appeal of Mark Twain in China
item.description: A biting political satire by the quintessentially American author that has long enjoyed popularity in China can provide insights into how many Chinese view democracy and capitalism.
item.dc:creator: By AMY QIN
item.media:description: For decades, one of Mark Twain's satires of American politics was required reading in Chinese schools.

item.title: Currents: Finding New Meaning in Life Through PowerPoint
item.description: A 77-year-old Colombian woman discovers the joy of learning to tell stories with a computer and an Internet connection.
item.dc:creator: By ANAND GIRIDHARADAS
item.media:description: Lourdes del Castillo de Rumié in her home in Cartagena, Colombia.

item.title: India Ink: The Man Who Forgot He Was Prime Minister
item.description: As the demands of Indian democracy grew more vocal, Prime Minister Manmohan Singh was defined by an imperturbable silence.
item.dc:creator: By VAIBHAV VATS
item.media:credit: Pool photo/Harish Tyagi, via Associated Press
item.media:description: Prime Minister Manmohan Singh addressing a press conference in New Delhi on Friday.

item.title: German Leader Injured in Skiing Accident
item.description: Chancellor Angela Merkel has canceled most of her meetings for the next three weeks after she was injured over the Christmas holidays.
item.dc:creator: By MELISSA EDDY

item.title: Sudan’s Leader Flies to South for Crisis Talks
item.description: President Omar Hassan al-Bashir is meeting the leaders of South Sudan, where fighting has been raging.
item.category: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
item.dc:creator: By NICHOLAS KULISH

item.title: Fresh Signs of a Cooling Economy in China
item.description: Growth in the service sector slowed in December, purchasing managers’ surveys showed, adding to fears of a further pullback in 2014.
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS

item.title: South Korea Proposes Resuming Reunions of War-Divided Families
item.description: President Park Geun-hye’s overture came five days after the North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un, urged the creation of “a favorable climate for improved relations.”
item.dc:creator: By CHOE SANG-HUN

item.title: Freed Russian Oligarch Leaves Germany for Switzerland With Family
item.description: A statement from aides to Mikhail B. Khodorkovsky, the former oil tycoon, said he has “not yet made any plans about permanent residency in Switzerland or anywhere else.”
item.dc:creator: By ALISON SMALE

item.title: India Ink: A.T.M. Makers See Opportunity in Long Lines at Rural Branches of Banks
item.description: After the central bank said it wanted to include more of the country in the financial sector, cash-machine manufacturers are eager to enter a new market.
item.dc:creator: By RADHIKA OBEROI
item.media:description: A resident of Mangali village at a State Bank of India A.T.M. in Hisar district of Haryana on Nov. 25, 2013.
